bibl.title: House of Representatives Bill No. 13639, January 17, 1901

div1.p: This bill would award a pension to Mabel Lazear.

div1.head: House of Representatives Bill No. 13639, January 17, 1901
div1.opener:
56TH CONGRESS,
2D SESSION.
H. R. 13639.
IN THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.
JANUARY 17, 1901.
div1.p:
Mr. DENNY introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Com
mittee on Pensions and ordered to be printed.

A BILL
For pension to Mabel H. Lazear.

1 Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representa-
2 tives of the United States of America in Congress assembled.
3 That the Secretary of the Interior be, and he is hereby, au-
4 thorized and directed to place on the pension roll, subject to
5 the provisions and limitations of the pension laws, the name
6 of Mabel H. Lazear, widow of Jesse W. Lazear, late surgeon on
7 staff of Surgeon-General United States Army, and specially
8 detailed for work in Cuba in connection with the investiga-
9 tion of yellow fever, and particularly as to its propagation and
10 transmission, and who contracted yellow fever at Columbia
11 Barracks, Cuba, in September, nineteen hundred, and died
12 therefrom on September twenty-fifth, nineteen hundred, after
13 accomplishing important results of great and lasting benefit
14 to the service, and that the Secretary pay her a pension at
2
1 the rate of thirty dollars per month, and two dollars per month
2 to each of the two minor children of said surgeon during their
3 minority.

A BILL
For pension to Mabel H. Lazear.

JANUARY 17, 1901.--Referred to the Committee on Pen-
sions and ordered to be printed.
